direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods generate lists of strings, but sentences() generates sentences while words() generates individual words.
Both methods involve generating text with multiple sentences, but paragraph() combines them into a single string.
Both methods generate strings of a specified length, but fixedString() uses sentences to achieve this.
Both methods handle cases where the length is zero or negative in a similar manner.

enhanced_by.reason: Both methods require the generation of words, which can be used to set up the state for sentences().
sentence(int) is directly invoked within sentences(int) to generate individual sentences.
Both methods generate text that can be used to verify the correctness of the generated sentences.
